text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Immigration Act 2004 (Visas) 

(Amendment) (No. 3) Order 2021.

title: conferred on me by section 17 of the Immigration Act 2004 (No. 1 of 2004) (as
heading: (a) Subject to paragraph (b), this Order comes into operation on 31
text_raw:
2. 

(a) Subject to paragraph (b), this Order comes into operation on 31 

October 2021. 

(b) Paragraph (c) of Article 3 shall be deemed to have come into 

operation on 16 June 2021.
text_norm: 2 (a) subject paragraph (b) order come operation 31 october 2021 (b) paragraph (c) article 3 shall deemed come operation 16 june 2021

title: conferred on me by section 17 of the Immigration Act 2004 (No. 1 of 2004) (as
heading: 3. The Immigration Act 2004 (Visas) Order 2014 (S.I. No. 473 of 2014) is
text_raw:
3. The Immigration Act 2004 (Visas) Order 2014 (S.I. No. 473 of 2014) is 

amended – 

(a) 

in Article 3(d), by the substitution of “31 October 2026” for “10 
July 2020”, 

(b) 

in Schedule 3, by the insertion of – 

(i) 

“Colombia” after “Bosnia and Herzegovina”, 

(ii) 

“Indonesia” after “India”, 

(iii) “Kosovo” after “Kazakhstan”, 

(iv) “Peru” and “Philippines” after “People’s Republic of 

China”, 

(v) 

“Republic of North Macedonia” after “Qatar”, and 

(vi) “Vietnam” after “Uzbekistan”, and 

(c) 

in Schedule 5, by the deletion of “Colombia”. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 26th October, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [538] 3 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

21 October, 2021. 

HEATHER HUMPHREYS, 

Minister for Justice. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [538]

title: conferred on me by section 17 of the Immigration Act 2004 (No. 1 of 2004) (as
heading: (This is not part of the Statutory Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This is not part of the Statutory Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This Order further amends the Immigration Act 2004 (Visas) Order 2014. 

Its main purpose is to reinstate the Short-Stay Visa Waiver Programme with 
effect from 31 October 2021, to extend the Programme until 31 October 2026, 
and to add Colombia, Indonesia, Kosovo, Peru, Philippines, Republic of North 
Macedonia and Vietnam to the list of states or territorial entities in Schedule 3 
of the 2014 Order whose nationals may be covered by the Programme. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [538] 5
